keyword: calories in a can of sardines
title: Calories in a Can of Sardines
meta_description: Discover calories in a can of sardines, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for your diet.
h1: Calories in a Can of Sardines
assumptions: Standard 3.75 oz (106g) can in oil, drained solids; includes edible bones; no added sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, packing medium (oil/water), size, and draining method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard can of sardines provides ~191 kcal and ~25 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Packed in water instead of oil
Add 1 tsp olive oil for serving

faqs.q: How many calories in a can of sardines in oil?
faqs.a: About 191 kcal for a standard 3.75 oz drained can.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a can of sardines?
faqs.a: Roughly 25 g protein per can, making it a great lean source.
Typically 0 g carbs per can, ideal for low-carb diets.

faqs.q: How does packing medium affect calories in sardines?
faqs.a: Oil-packed adds ~50 kcal; water-packed is lower in fat and calories.

faqs.q: Are canned sardines high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 465 mg per can; opt for low-sodium versions if needed.
